page.title: 01Pevensey and Westham
page.content: The region comprises{Pevensey {village, Pevensey Bay and Westham {village}.It is a very{marshy area bordering the English Channel,indeed at one time the sea came inland as far as Pevensey village,lapping the walls of the castle.A naturally formed shingle bank moved the sea 2.5Km Southward. Now the area has been drained and is chiefly grazing land.Buildings range from the Roman and Norman castles and hundreds of years old houses to the modern holiday bungalows.This is a popular tourist area with an historic background of {William the Conqueror's landing}in England.There are pleasant beaches having a range of facilities.This is also a popular area for many retired people,and is central to several surrounding towns, like Hastings,Bexhill and Eastbourne.
